text.0: cheif priest is agni at the laud as stones and grass at sacrifice.
text.1: with song i seek the maruts brahmaṇaspati gods for help much to be desired.
text.2: i sing to cattle and to earth to trees to dawns to night to plants.
text.3: o all ye vasus ye possessors of all wealth be ye the furtherers of our thoughts.
text.4: forth go with agni to the gods our sacrifice of ancient use.
text.5: to the Ādityas varuṇa whose law stands fast and the alllightening marut troop.
text.6: lords of all wealth may they be strengtheners of man destroyers of his enemies.
text.7: lords of all wealth do ye with guards which none may harm preserve our dwelling free from foes.
text.8: come to us with one mind today come to us all with one accord.
text.9: maruts with holy song and goddess aditi mighty one to our house and home.
text.10: send us delightful things ye maruts on your steeds come ye o mitra to our gifts.
text.11: let indra varuṇa and the Ādityas sit swift heroes on our sacred grass.
text.12: we who have trimmed the grass for you and set the banquet in array.
text.13: and pressed the soma call you varuina like men with sacrificial fires aflame.
text.14: o maruts visinu aśvins pūṣan haste away with minds turned hitherward to me.
text.15: let the strong indra famed as vṛtras slayer come first with the winners of the spoil.
text.16: ye guileless gods bestow on us a refuge strong on every side.
text.17: a sure protection vasus unassailable from near at hand or from afar.
text.18: kinship have i with you and close alliance o ye gods destroyers of our foes.
text.19: call us to our prosperity of former days and soon to new klicity.
text.20: for now have i sent forth to you that i may win a fair reward.
text.21: lords of all wealth with homage this my song of praise like a milchcow that faileth not.
text.22: excellent savitar hath mounted up on high for you ye sure and careful guides.
text.23: bipeds and quadrupeds with several hopes and aims and birds have settled to their tasks.
text.24: singing their praise with godlike thought let us invoke each god for grace.
text.25: each god to bring you help each god to strengthen you.
text.26: for of one spirit are the gods with mortal man cosharers all of gracious gifts.
text.27: may they increase our strength hereafter and today providing case and ample room.
text.28: i laud you o ye guileless gods here where we meet to render praise.
text.29: none varuṇa and mitra harins the mortal man who honours and obeys your laws.
text.30: he makes his house endure he gathers plenteous food who pays obedience to your will.
text.31: born in his sons anew he spreads as law commands and prospers every way unharmed.
text.32: een without war he gathers wealth and goes hisway on pleasant paths.
text.33: whom mitra varuṇa and aryaman protect sharing the giftof one accord.
text.34: een on the plain for him ye make a sloping path an easy way where road is none.
text.35: and far away from him the ineffectual shaft must vanish shot at him in vain.
text.36: if ye appoint the rite today kind rulers when the sun ascends.
text.37: lords of all wealth at sunset or at wakingtime or be it at the noon of day.
text.38: or asuras when ye have sheltered the worshipper who goes to sacrifice at eve.
text.39: may we o vasus ye possessors of all wealth come then into the midst of you.
text.40: if ye today at sunrise or at noon or in the gloom of eve.
text.41: lords of all riches give fair treasure to the man the wise man who hath sacrificed.
text.42: then we imperial rulers claim of you this boon your wide protection as a son.
text.43: may we Ādityas offering holy gifts obtain that which shall bring us greater bliss.
